page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT IN BISHOPS FROME
page.content: With agriculture being the main industry, employment opportunities within the area are not as great as they used to be. There is grear seasonal variation, with August, September and October being particularly busy. Extra labour is required for the harvesting of hops, apples and potatoes. Many local housewives find work at this time, but at hop-picking it is traditional for gipsies to be employed. Encampments can be seen in fields and on road side verges, opnly to disappear when all the hops are picked. The small trades and industries also offer some employment: Frome Valley Transport - 16 employees. Hodges and Sons Buckets - 14 employees. Holden Heating - 4 employees.
